translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The Eighth Chapter🔽Discussion of the Form-element
Are ideas that are in the form-element the form-element?
They are.

original: Rūpaṁ bhavo gati sattāvāso saṁsāro yoni viññāṇaṭṭhiti attabhāvapaṭilābhoti?
analyzed: rūpam bhavaḥ gati sattā vāso sa sāraḥ yoni viññāṇa ṭṭhiti atta bhāva paṭilābho ti
translated: Are form, becoming, destiny, station of consciousness, abode of beings, generation, class of consciousness, reappearance, acquisition of an individual nature,
They are not. …
Is there any action that goes to the form-element?
They are not. …
Are there any beings that go to the form-element?
They are not. …

original: rūpe sattā jāyanti jīyanti mīyanti cavanti upapajjantīti?
analyzed: rūpe sattāḥ jāyanti jīyanti mīyanti cavanti upapajjanti iti
translated: Are beings born, age, die, pass away, reappear, in the form-element?
They are not. …

original: rūpe atthi rūpaṁ vedanā saññā saṅkhārā viññāṇanti?
analyzed: rūpe atthi rūpam vedanā saññā saṅkhārāḥ viññāṇanti
translated: Are there in the form-element form, feeling, perception, determinations, consciousness?
They are not. …
Is the form-element the five categories?
They are not. …
Is the form-element becoming, destiny, …
acquisition of an individual nature?
They are.
Is form becoming, destiny, …
acquisition of an individual nature?
They are not. …
Is there any action that goes to the form-element?
They are.
Is there any action that goes to the form-element?
They are not. …

analyzed: atthi rūpa dhātu upagā sattā ati
translated: Are there beings who are reborn in the form realm?”
The Invitation Ceremony.
“Are there beings who are reborn in the form realm?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: Rūpadhātuyā sattā jāyanti jīyanti mīyanti cavanti upapajjantīti?
analyzed: rūpadhātuyā sattāḥ jāyanti jīyanti mīyanti cavanti upapajjanti iti
translated: “Do beings take rebirth in the form realm, age, and die there, pass away and be reborn there?”
The Invitation Ceremony.

original: Rūpe sattā jāyanti jīyanti mīyanti cavanti upapajjantīti?
analyzed: rūpe sattāḥ jāyanti jīyanti mīyanti cavanti upapajjanti iti
translated: “Do beings take rebirth in form, age, and die there, pass away and be reborn there?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: rūpadhātuyā atthi rūpaṁ vedanā saññā saṅkhārā viññāṇanti?
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyāḥ atthi rūpam vedanā saññā saṅkhārāḥ viññāṇanti
translated: “Is there form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness in the form realm?”
The Invitation Ceremony.

original: Rūpe atthi rūpaṁ vedanā saññā saṅkhārā viññāṇanti?
analyzed: rūpe atthi rūpam vedanā saññā saṅkhārāḥ viññāṇanti
translated: “Is there form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness in form?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the form realm a five-sector realm?”
The Invitation Ceremony.
“Is form a five-sector realm?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the eye-consciousness element?” …

original: Rūpino dhammā rūpadhātu, kāmadhātuyā atthi rūpanti?
analyzed: rūpino dhammā rūpa dhātu kāmadhātuyāḥ atthi rūpanti
translated: “Are form-possessing things the form realm? Is there form in the sense realm?”
The Invitation Ceremony.

analyzed: sā ava kāmadhātu sā rūpadhātu uti
translated: “Is the sense realm the form realm?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: sā ava kāmadhātu sā rūpadhātu uti
translated: “Is the sense realm the form realm?”
The Invitation Ceremony.

original: Kāmabhavena samannāgato puggalo dvīhi bhavehi samannāgato hoti—
analyzed: kāma bhavena samannāgataḥ puggalaḥ dvīhi bhavehi samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: “Is a person who possesses the sense realm also possessed of two realms—

analyzed: kāma bhavena ca rūpa bhavena ca ati
translated: and the sensual-sphere existence and the fine-material-sphere existence?
“No, friend.”
The Discussion of the Fine-Material Sphere is ended.
